Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide Proposition -- 17.10 Mills Continuation - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), be authorized to continue to levy and collect a special ad valorem tax of seventeen and ten hundredths (17.10) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $1,782,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of operating, maintaining, constructing and improving parish roads, bridges, drainage canals and related facilities and equipment in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Tallulah -- .5% S&U Tax - CC - 20 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Tallulah, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, as amended, and other authority, be authorized, to levy and collect a sales and use tax of one-half of a percent (.5%) on sales at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales and services within the City, as defined by law, inclusive (the "Tax") (an estimated $342,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of twenty (20) years commencing effective April 1, 2020, and shall the proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administration) be dedicated and used for any lawful purpose including but not limited to funding for the construction, improvement, renovation, of water and sewer utility facilities and the operation and maintenance?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Delta -- 7 Mills - M&BOA - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Village of Delta, State of Louisiana (the "Village"), be authorized to levy a special tax of seven (7) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Village (an estimated $6,300 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2029, for the purpose of constructing, improving, maintaining and keeping in repair the public roads, highways and bridges within the Village?

Race.SpecificTitle: Afton Fire Protection District -- $125.00 Service Charge - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Afton Fire Protection District Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Afton Fire Protection District of the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual service charge of One Hundred Twenty-Five Dollars ($125.00) from persons owning each residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028 (an estimated $28,250 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the service charge for an entire year), for paying costs of fire protection services for the District, including the cost of acquiring, operating and maintaining equipment and facilities for fire protection, and, for assessing and collecting said service charge, owners shall be assessed a charge for each such structure which they own, each residential or commercial unit and each housing unit within a multiple dwelling structure shall be considered a separate structure, and a mobile home, as defined in R.S. 9:1149.2(3), shall be considered a structure, provided that persons owning mobile homes shall be assessed eighty percent (80%) of the service charge, all as provided in La. R.S. 40:1502.4?
